subject: RE: [junit] unit testing
msgSnippet: How about responding this month? August 25?! :) So said  Jason Rogers  on  2002-08-25 ... 5 ... 7 ... u ... http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/ J. B.
messageBody:
How about responding this month? August 25?! :)

So said Jason Rogers on 2002-08-25

>How about searching the archives for such information before posting
>here?
>
>
>
>=jason
>[:question | ^One]
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: malla6um [mailto:malla6um@...]
>Sent: Thursday, October 24, 2002 2:21 PM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] unit testing
>
>
>Since I am new to unittesting, I think this will be an ideal platform
>to put my questions.
>
>1) How should unit testing be done for a web application development?
>2) What different options, other than junit, do I have if I want to
>do:
>a) Unit Testing
>b) Functional Testing
>
>3) what are the weaknesses of junit? How can they be resolved?
>
>3) Through some preliminary reading, I figure that one can come
>across various compatibility issues specially if we are using
>tomcat,cactus, httpunit, junit, struts,struts related tests. How to
>best deal with such kind of issues.
>
>4) What are the weaknesses of cactus? How can they be resolved?
>
>I would really appreciate getting answers from this forum as this
>forum constitutes people who are well versed with this testing
>mechanism.
>Thanks.
>
>
>
>
